Getting Started 1

content:
You may specify options in config.toml (or config.yaml/config.json) of your site to make use of this theme’s features.
For an example of config.toml, see config.toml in exampleSite.
Params # Source Code repository section description = &quot;put your description&quot; github_repository = &quot;https://github.com/thingsym/hugo-theme-techdoc&quot; version = &quot;0.9.3&quot; # Documentation repository section # documentation repository (set edit link to documentation repository) github_doc_repository = &quot;https://github.com/thingsym/hugo-theme-techdoc&quot; # Analytic section google_analytics_id = &quot;&quot; # Your Google Analytics tracking id tag_manager_container_id = &quot;&quot; # Your Google Tag Manager container id google_site_verification = &quot;&quot; # Your Google Site Verification for Search Console # Open Graph and Twitter Cards settings section # Open Graph settings for each page are set on the front matter. # See https://gohugo.io/templates/internal/#open-graph # See https://gohugo.io/templates/internal/#twitter-cards title = &quot;Hugo Techdoc Theme&quot; images = [&quot;images/og-image.png&quot;] # Open graph images are placed in `static/images` # Theme settings section # Theme color # See color value reference https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/color custom_font_color = &quot;&quot; custom_background_color = &quot;&quot; # Documentation Menu section # Menu style settings menu_style = &quot;open-menu&quot; # &quot;open-menu&quot; or &quot;slide-menu&quot; # Date format dateformat = &quot;&quot; # default &quot;2 Jan 2006&quot; # See the format reference https://gohugo.io/functions/format/#hugo-date-and-time-templating-reference # path name excluded from documentation menu menu_exclusion = [ &quot;archives&quot;, &quot;archive&quot;, &quot;blog&quot;, &quot;entry&quot;, &quot;post&quot;, &quot;posts&quot;, ] # Algolia site search section # See https://www.algolia.com/doc/ algolia_search_enable = true algolia_indexName = …
title: Configuration

content:
Download Hugo theme If you have git installed, you can do the following at the command-line-interface within the Hugo directory:
cd themes git clone https://github.com/thingsym/hugo-theme-techdoc.git For more information read the Hugo documentation.
Configure You may specify options in config.toml (or config.yaml/config.json) of your site to make use of this theme&rsquo;s features.
For an example of config.toml, see config.toml in exampleSite.
See the Configuration documentation.
Preview site To preview your site, run Hugo&rsquo;s built-in local server.
hugo server -t hugo-theme-techdoc Browse site on http://localhost:1313
title: Installation

content:
See https://gohugo.io/content-management/shortcodes/#use-hugos-built-in-shortcodes
figure   2 People Sitting With View of Yellow Flowers during Daytime   gist  highlight &lt;section id=&#34;main&#34;&gt; &lt;div&gt; &lt;h1 id=&#34;title&#34;&gt;{{ .Title }}&lt;/h1&gt; {{ range .Data.Pages }} {{ .Render &#34;summary&#34;}} {{ end }} &lt;/div&gt; &lt;/section&gt; instagram    View this post on Instagram        #Talitha #Getty #yacht in #fjærland #fjærlandsfjorden #sognefjorden #mundal #norway #landscape #panorama #travel #instagoodmyphoto #justgoshoot #peoplescreatives #visualsoflife #photography #photoshoot #photodaily #photogram #instagood #picoftheday #fjærland #photooftheday #pentax #nrksf #sognavis
